text: Ta'al, Hebrew: תע"ל , a Hebrew acronym of Tnu'a Aravit LeHithadshut, Hebrew: תנועה ערבית להתחדשות (the Arab version: ?, Arab: الحركة العربية للتغيير), both meaning Arab Movement for Renewal, is an Israeli Arab political party. Its ideology is right-wing centrist, Arab nationalist, secular and anti-Zionist. Its political leader is Ahmad Tibi. It was founded in the 1990s by Tibi. It ran in the 1996 elections under the name Arab Union, but won only 2,087 votes. Number of seats in the 24th Knesset: 2 (-1). Ta'al cooperated with Balad and Hadash as part of the Joint List until 2022. Together they have 6 seats. == Other websites == * ==References== Category:1990s establishments in Israel Category:Nationalist organizations in Israel Category:Political parties in Israel
title: Ta'al
